description: Enterprise techniques used by APT39, ATT&CK group G0087 v2.0
name: APT39 (G0087)

techniques.comment: APT39 used custom tools to create SOCK5 proxies between infected hosts.
APT39 has used Mimikatz, Ncrack, Windows Credential Editor and ProcDump to dump credentials.
APT39 has used WinRAR and 7-Zip to compress an archive stolen data.
APT39 used a custom port scanner known as BLUETORCH
APT39 has maintained persistence using the startup folder.
APT39 has been seen using RDP for lateral movement and persistence.
APT39 used secure shell (SSH) to move laterally among their targets.
APT39 utilized custom scripts to perform internal reconnaissance.
APT39 has repacked a modified version of Mimikatz to thwart anti-virus detection.
APT39 leveraged spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to initially compromise victims.
APT39 leveraged spearphishing emails with malicious links to initially compromise victims.
APT39 has used nbtscan to discover vulnerable systems.
APT39 used Remexi to collect usernames from the system.
APT39 has sent spearphishing emails in an attempt to lure users to click on a malicious attachment or link.
APT39 has used stolen credentials to compromise Outlook Web Access (OWA).
APT39 has installed ANTAK and ASPXSPY web shells.
